definitions.definition: Rebuilding or restructuring ; large scale repair or renewal ; revitalisation .
examples: The conversion of so many old industrial buildings into living quarters was a major factor in the regeneration .

definitions.definition: Spiritual rebirth ; the change from a carnal or material life to a pious one
The renewal of the world at the second coming of Christ .
The process by which a water softener flushes out minerals extracted from the water supply .
The ability to rapidly heal substantial physical damage to one's body, or to spontaneously restore hit points .
The property of a kind of circuit , much used in radio receivers , that allows an electronic signal to be amplified many times through a feedback loop .

main_definition: Rebuilding or restructuring ; large scale repair or renewal ; revitalisation .
secondary_definitions: ( theology ) Spiritual rebirth ; the change from a carnal or material life to a pious one
( Christianity ) The renewal of the world at the second coming of Christ .
The process by which a water softener flushes out minerals extracted from the water supply .
( roleplaying games , fantasy ) The ability to rapidly heal substantial physical damage to one's body, or to spontaneously restore hit points .
The property of a kind of circuit , much used in radio receivers , that allows an electronic signal to be amplified many times through a feedback loop .
